question: Which spinal nerve root provides sensory innervation to the Axilla and upper chest?
short_explanation: The T2 dermatome covers the Axilla and upper chest.
long_explanation: Dermatomes represent areas of skin innervated by specific spinal nerve roots. The T2 root supplies sensation to the Axilla and upper chest, a critical zone for diagnosing radiculopathies and nerve root lesions.
clinical_application: Massage therapists and clinicians can use dermatome maps to identify referred pain, nerve root compression, or spinal dysfunctionsmaking the T2 dermatome essential in cases involving the Axilla and upper chest.
